text:
I’m definitely read the title and skim all the time, it’s a reasonable thing to do in some circumstances. 

What I don’t understand is why someone would post a comment saying the author doesn’t know what they’re talking about without having actually read the post

text:
I find engagement on twitter to be much better for AD stuff.
Maybe for tech stuff in general?
I've never had anything explode on twitter though. So that might change it. But I think dry technical pieces  rarely had enough drama for that

Hacker News gets the views.
I think right now that is sitting on ~900 views, 750 from Hacker News, 100 from Twitter.

But on Hacker News that is basically 750 randoms. Which is cool. Point is it get information out there. So it's doing it's thing. It's working

Where as twitter that's 50 randoms and like 40 people who know what they are talking about, and 10 people who specialize in this. So it's doing it's thing. It's working too.

text: I personally finds HN ppl are more interested in AD, and Twitter ppl are more interested in quantum computing somehow. based on previous blog posts I wrote
